unsigned COPSmessage::lenght (   )  [inline]
 

Size of the pointer returned by data()

COPSmessage::operator int (   )  [inline]
 

Enables casting to int in order to use switch mechanims to parse the message based on the message Common Header Op Code Example: 

                 COPSmessage m;
                 switch (m) {
                         case REQ:
                                cerr << "Got a Request Message";
                                break;
                         case DEC:
                                cerr << "Got a Decision Message";
                                break;
                                }

bool COPSmessage::operator!= (  COPSCommonHeader::OpCode  code  ) 
 

Reverse of operator==

COPSmessage & COPSmessage::operator= (  const COPSmessage &   ) 
 

bool COPSmessage::operator== (  COPSCommonHeader::OpCode  code  ) 
 

Compares a message with a COPSCommonHeader OpCode. Based on the OpCode of the COPSmessage COPSCommonHeader will return true or false

Friends And Related Function Documentation

COPSmessage& operator+ (  COPSmessage &  c,
const COPSObj &  obj
)  [friend]
 

Provides the means to incrementaly associate COPS Objects to a COPS message Example: 

                        COPSmessage msg;
                        COPSCommonHeader hdr;
                        COPSHandle hdl;
                        COPSContext cont;
                        msg+hdr+hdl+cont;
Parameters:
c COPSmessage to which the Objects will be appended
obj COPSObject to be appended

COPSmessage& operator+ (  COPSmessage &  c,
const COPSCommonHeader &  h
)  [friend]
 

This operator provides the means to create a message by "+" to the COPSmessage

std::ostream& operator<< (  std::ostream &  o,
const COPSmessage &  cops
)  [friend]
 

Socket& operator<< (  Socket &  socket,
const COPSmessage &  m
)  [friend]
 

Will send to a previously create TCP socket the COPS message Example: 

                        Socket s;
                        COPSmessage m;
                        s << m;
Parameters:
socket TCP socket
m COPSmessage fully constructed (contains header plus objects)

Socket& operator>> (  Socket &  socket,
COPSmessage &  m
)  [friend]
 

Will receive from a previously create TCP socket the COPS message. Please note that this is a blocking function, it will block until a COPSmessage is received (valid or not) Example: 

                        Socket s;
                        COPSmessage m;
                        s >> m;
Parameters:
socket TCP socket
m COPSmessage as retrieved from network
